item.description:
EVENT: We planning a 1.5 mile leisurely walk on a very popular path around Jamaica Pond
with a picnic lunch afterwards as well! The pond is located in the Jamaica Plain neighborhood
of Boston and it was included in the Cityâ€™s "Emerald Necklace" of parks in 1892. The Pond
covers over 60 acres and is stocked with fish and open for boating too.

Trip's Coordinator: Andrea (anissenbaum@lycos.com) or (617) 469-9599 up to 9:00pm.
RSVP: Required by April 9th to Andrea's address or phone listed above. Include a cell phone number in case we have to get through to you on the 11th
MEET: 11:30am at the Boat House. There is parking on the west side of the pond on
Perkins st. Rain Cancels.
COST: $5.00 for non-members

Shortly we will be closing down our Meetup Calendar and moving our events to a new Boston resource, Jewishboston.com.
JewishBoston.com is an excellent website for Jews in Boston where we can find an immediate connection to all the Jewish things that are happening in area right now. Discover links to cultural events (music, dance, film, lectures, cooking classes), Jewish education and lots of other organizations (synagogues, community centers, professional networking). All of our events will now be located at this new site so check it out!
item.how_to_find_us: Contact Andrea for the details and give her your cell Number so she can make a connection if necessary

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: WALK AROUND JAMAICA POND
